materials.raw_text: Co: 80 g, Fe: 40 g, P: 70 g, Pr: 10 g

sourcing.instructions:
Co (Cobalt powder) - Specialty metal suppliers or online metal marketplaces. 
 Fe (Iron powder) - Available at local hardware stores or online. 
 P (Phosphorus powder) - Chemical supply companies or online retailers. 
 Pr (Praseodymium oxide) - Rare earth metal suppliers or specialized online vendors.
steps: Co (Cobalt powder) - Specialty metal suppliers or online metal marketplaces.
Fe (Iron powder) - Available at local hardware stores or online.
P (Phosphorus powder) - Chemical supply companies or online retailers.
Pr (Praseodymium oxide) - Rare earth metal suppliers or specialized online vendors.
1. Measure out 80 g of cobalt powder.
2. Measure out 40 g of iron powder.
3. Measure out 70 g of phosphorus powder.
4. Measure out 10 g of praseodymium oxide.
5. Combine all measured powders in a clean, dry mixing bowl.
6. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to achieve a uniform blend of the powders.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 80 g of cobalt powder. 
 2. Measure out 40 g of iron powder. 
 3. Measure out 70 g of phosphorus powder. 
 4. Measure out 10 g of praseodymium oxide. 
 5. Combine all measured powders in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 
 6. Use a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer to achieve a uniform blend of the powders.

steps: 1. Transfer the homogeneous powder mixture into a heat-resistant crucible.
3. Once the desired temperature is reached, place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete fusion of the materials.
heating.raw_text:
1. Transfer the homogeneous powder mixture into a heat-resistant crucible. 
 2. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C. 
 3. Once the desired temperature is reached, place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete fusion of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down slowly to ambient temperature (approximately 1-2 hours).
2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled down to prevent thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text:
1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down slowly to ambient temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). 
 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled down to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible.
2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material into the required dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches).
3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish.
4. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear protective coating to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text:
1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 
 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the material into the required dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 
 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 
 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear protective coating to enhance durability.
